result.execSummary:
The defendant Brionn Anthony Stokes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession With Intent To Deliver Cocaine (>15-40 Grams) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: AODA assessment. Comply with recommended treatment.

Court ordered no possession  or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No new law violations.
No contact with firearms.
Obtain/maintain full time employment/schooling or combination of both.

Thinking For A Change course.
Cooperate with agent.

superTimeConds.notes: 75 hours of community service at a nonprofit organization.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
All mandatory court costs, fees and assessments to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court waives all nonmandatory costs due to inability to pay.
-Restitution set at $0.00

Court advised defendant of right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

charges.descr: Possession With Intent To Deliver Cocaine (>15-40 Grams)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brionn Anthony Stokes

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief

Defendant Brionn Anthony Stokes appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Brionn Anthony Stokes.  Attorney Annie Louk and Attorney Patrick T. Franken appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Plea/Sentencing hearing.

Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

As to Count 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint/ Information as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded. State has complied with victim notification. Statements by parties and defendant. 

As to Count 1: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 5 years, concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 29 days time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 2 years, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 years. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
- Obtain/maintain full time employment/schooling or combination of both.
- Thinking for a Change course.
- No new law violations. 
- Cooperate with agent. 
- 75 hours of community service at a non-profit organization.
- Restitution set at $0.00.
- All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
- Any cash bail on deposit to apply if applicable.
- Provide DNA Sample.
- No contact with firearms.
- Defendant is NOT eligible for expungement.


*Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program AND the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Received and Filed. Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights/Addendum
Received and Filed. Letters of support

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court, defendant Brionn Anthony Stokes not in court, in custody.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Defendant in custody, not produced.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court, defendant Brionn Anthony Stokes not in court, in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared on behalf of Patrick Franken for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the state. Defense further requests additional time to speak with client. Case adjourned for a Status Conference to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brionn Anthony Stokes in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Brionn Anthony Stokes in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Allis Detective S. Kuhnmuench. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brionn Anthony Stokes in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Preliminary Hearing. Attorney Sylvie Jaspen to be appointed pending conflict check. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Brionn Anthony Stokes in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Brionn Anthony Stokes in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brionn Anthony Stokes appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
